about.title: About Our Society
about.content: The Surrey Students' Law Society is a lively community of law students committed to promoting legal knowledge, professional growth, and networking opportunities. We offer a platform for students to connect with legal professionals, take part in moot court competitions, and build essential skills for their future careers in law.

offerings.title: What We Offer
offerings.content: Our society organises regular workshops, guest lectures by legal professionals, networking events, and social activities. We also offer opportunities for students to take part in national and international legal competitions, helping them gain practical experience and professional connections.

community.title: Join Our Community
community.content: Whether you're a first-year law student or in your final year, there's a place for you in our society. We welcome students from all backgrounds and experience levels. Join us to maximise your legal education and forge lasting friendships with fellow aspiring lawyers.

events.title: Upcoming Events
events.description: Stay informed about our latest events, workshops, and activities. Follow us on social media and check back often for updates on what's happening within our law society community.

items.title: Law Ball
items.description: Enhance your legal writing abilities with our expert-led workshop series.

image.alt: Default image for Legal Writing Workshop

content.text: Our comprehensive legal writing workshop series is designed to transform your legal writing skills from basic to professional level. Whether you're a first-year student or preparing for your final year, this workshop will provide you with the essential tools and techniques needed for effective legal communication.

• Legal memorandum writing and structure
• Case brief analysis and presentation
• Contract drafting fundamentals
• Legal research methodology
• Citation and referencing standards
• Professional legal correspondence

Week 1: Foundations of Legal Writing
• Day 1-2: Legal writing principles and structure
• Day 3-4: Research methods and case analysis
• Day 5: Practice session and feedback

Week 2: Advanced Applications
• Day 1-2: Contract drafting and negotiation
• Day 3-4: Legal memorandum writing
• Day 5: Final project and certification

• Certificate of completion for your CV
• Sample writing portfolio for job applications
• Networking with legal professionals
• Practical skills for moot court competitions
• Enhanced academic performance
Limited to 25 students per session. Early registration recommended. Contact us for group discounts and payment plans.

items.title: Networking Events
items.description: Network with legal professionals and grow your professional connections.

article.location: Various locations in Guildford and London

content.text: Our monthly networking events bring together law students, practicing lawyers, judges, and legal professionals from various sectors. These events provide invaluable opportunities to build relationships, gain insights into different legal careers, and discover internship and job opportunities.

September: 'Meet the Barristers' - Guildford Crown Court
October: 'In-House Counsel Panel' - London Legal District
November: 'International Law Perspectives' - University Campus
December: 'Holiday Networking Mixer' - Guildford Town Centre

• 6:00-6:30 PM: Registration and welcome drinks
• 6:30-7:30 PM: Panel discussion or keynote speaker
• 7:30-8:30 PM: Networking session with professionals
• 8:30-9:00 PM: Informal conversations and follow-ups

• Professional dress code required
• Business cards encouraged
• Pre-event preparation materials provided
• Post-event follow-up guidance
• LinkedIn group access for continued networking

Previous attendees have secured:
• Summer internships at top law firms
• Mentorship opportunities with senior lawyers
• Job offers upon graduation
• Valuable career advice and guidance

items.title: Moot Court Competition
items.description: Join our annual moot court competition and demonstrate your advocacy skills.

article.location: University of Surrey, Moot Court Room

content.text: Our annual moot court competition is the highlight of the academic year, providing students with the opportunity to argue real legal cases before experienced judges and barristers. This prestigious event tests your advocacy skills, legal knowledge, and courtroom presence.

• Preliminary Rounds: March 15-17 (all participants)
• Quarter Finals: March 18 (top 8 teams)
• Semi Finals: March 19 (top 4 teams)
• Grand Final: March 20 (championship match)

• Real appellate court cases
• Comprehensive case bundles provided
• 4 weeks preparation time
• Access to law library resources
• Mentoring from previous winners

• 1st Place: £500 cash prize + trophy
• 2nd Place: £300 cash prize + certificate
• 3rd Place: £200 cash prize + certificate
• Best Speaker Award: £100 + special recognition
• All finalists receive certificates for CVs

• Legal argument quality (40%)
• Advocacy skills and presentation (30%)
• Response to judicial questions (20%)
• Professional conduct (10%)
Teams of 2-3 students. Registration opens January 15, 2025. Early registration recommended as spaces are limited.
